protein.general_function: Involved in phosphoprotein phosphatase inhibitor activity
protein.specific_function: Inhibitor of protein-phosphatase 1. This protein may be important in hormonal control of glycogen metabolism. Hormones that elevate intracellular cAMP increase I-1 activity in many tissues. I-1 activation may impose cAMP control over proteins that are not directly phosphorylated by PKA. Following a rise in intracellular calcium, I-1 is inactivated by calcineurin (or PP2B). Does not inhibit type-2 phosphatases

reference.reference_text: Endo S, Zhou X, Connor J, Wang B, Shenolikar S: Multiple structural elements define the specificity of recombinant human inhibitor-1 as a protein phosphatase-1 inhibitor. Biochemistry. 1996 Apr 23;35(16):5220-8.
